keyPolicies.policyTitle: An NHS free at the point of delivery
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour is lying about UKIP and the NHS. It was Labour and the Tories who brought £80 billion of 'private finance (debt)' into the NHS, and Labour bigwigs have proposed charges. UKIP will give £3 billion extra to keep it free.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: No tax on the minimum wage
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Millions of the poorest workers, who work all week for the minimum wage, should not have to pay income tax at all.
We need to build more social and low-cost housing, on existing sites not green fields, to help local youngsters get on the ladder.
With blackouts looming, we must invest in affordable energy from shale gas and nuclear not huge, over-subsidised wind and solar farms.
The EU's 'free movement of labour' means lower wages, pressure on health, housing and benefits, and fewer jobs for our children.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: £55m a day membership fees to the EU
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Britain would be better off out - able to make our own trade with the rest of the world. The EU is the past, not the future.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: £12 billion a year in foreign aid
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We should help provide water and fight diseases, not subsidise regimes with their own space programmes like India and China.
Our welfare system, and our taxes, should be fair. We need simpler tax and welfare systems which help people get on.

issues.brexitEurope: Britain would be better off out - able to make our own trade with the rest of the world. The EU is the past, not the future.
